article:
'Intuition' is the ability to acquire knowledge without inference and/or the use
of reason. Oxford English Dictionary "The word 'intuition' comes from
the Latin word 'intueri' which is usually translated as 'to look inside' or 'to
contemplate'." Carlin Flora. "Gut Almighty". Psychology Today. Vol 40. Issue
3:68-75,2007. Intuition provides us with beliefs that we cannot justify in
every case. For this reason, it has been the subject of study in psychology, as
well as a topic of interest in the supernatural. The "right brain" is popularly
associated with intuitive processes such as aesthetic
abilities. [http://academic.cuesta.edu/acasupp/AS/312.HTM Converting Words
into Pictures--Reading Comprehension Guide--Academic
Support]. [http://frank.mtsu.edu/~studskl/hd/LRBrain.html Left/Right
Processing.] [http://psychology.jrank.org/pages/545/Right-Brain-
Hemisphere.html Right-Brain Hemisphere.] Some scientists have contended
that intuition is associated with innovation in scientific discovery. Gerald
Holton, Yehuda Elkana. Albert Einstein: Historical and Cultural Perspectives,
Dover Publications, July 1997, p. 97. ISBN 0-486-29879-5 "The workings of
intuition transcend those of the intellect, and as is well known, innovation is
often a triumph of intuition over logic." Intuition is also a common
subject of New Age writings. Peter Steinfels [http://www.nytimes.com/1996/07/13/us/beliefs-
080624.html Beliefs] [[The New York Times]], July 13, 1996.
